Tucson listens with a deep intensity and closes his optics to allow for bet=
ter audio performance.  Sounds become sharper and easier to hear.  Being bl=
ind for nearly his entire existence further enhances his ability to compens=
ate for not having his sense of sight.  Gently he places one palm on the wa=
ll, and then concentrates on what he feels on the bottom of his feet and on=
 the palms of his hands.  He takes a deep breath in to catch any scent that=
 may seem different to the scents around him.  And finally uses his sense o=
f thermal  registering which is felt through the nostrils of his somewhat d=
raconic facial features.  It was how a snake would detect it's prey and the=
 same held true for other reptiles.  He narrows an optic and speaks with a =
whisper.

" Night Viper, wait.  Something doesn't feel right.  I'm picking =
up vibrations through the wall and my thermal imaging system is detecting a=
n unknown entity.  You're reptilian derived as well, see if you can detect =
the same as I ."

Tucson moves in closer to protect the smaller Maximals fr=
om harm.

" If someone is following us we must move cautiously."

Perpetual=
ly on the move and constantly busy. 

On Oct 20, 2011, at 12:31 PM, Super C=
yclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson quietly =
maneuvers himself down the tunnel with surprising agility,
> > perhaps not =
as quickly as Night Viper but yet somewhat nimble himself. His
> > clawed l=
ike hands and foot talons curl around the ladder giving him
> > exceptional=
 agility. His wings though were an issue, but he keeps them tight
> > again=
st his back. What he did not have use of was his serpent like tail,
> > whi=
ch had quite a formidable grip as he discovered upon squeezing the piece
> =
> of scrap metal.
> >
> > Because of his somewhat serpent like form, he fou=
nd that perhaps his beast
> > mode would suit him better in the tunnel, bec=
ause all he would have to do is
> > slither while using his limbs to slide =
him along. But that would cause
> > noise and vibration. He carries on in r=
obot mode, staying behind to back
> > up the smaller Maximals.
> 
> <NEW>
>=
 
> The tunnel itself was a tight fit. Although TUSCOn and BIG CONVOY were
=
> able to fit down it, with their bulk it was only just barely. There
> was=
 not even enough room for either of them to transform if they
> needed to. =
Although TUSCON would fit in the tunnel in robot or beast
> mode, the act o=
f transforming required a little more room then the
> tunnel would allow fo=
r. And BIG CONVOY's beast mode, that of a woolly
> mammoth would definitely=
 not work going down the tunnels.
> 
> The trip was long and aurduous, even=
 for this MAXIMALS. Crawling
> through level upon level of tunnel, they pas=
sed by other prison cells,
> some empty, others seeming to have occupants, =
that judging by the odd
> smells, had a more biological rather than technol=
ogical origin.
> 
> "We're almost there." NIGHT VIPER whispered from below.=
 "Everything
> should be ready."
> 
> BIG CONVOY nodded from above, "It bet=
ter be, I'm ready to get out of
> this place." His voice was low but there =
was a steel to it as well.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson listens with a deep intensity a=
nd closes his optics to allow for better audio performance.  Sounds be=
come sharper and easier to hear.  Being blind for nearly his entire ex=
istence further enhances his ability to compensate for not having his sense=
 of sight.  Gently he places one palm on the wall, and then concentrat=
es on what he feels on the bottom of his feet and on the palms of his hands=
.  He takes a deep breath in to catch any scent that may seem differen=
t to the scents around him.  And finally uses his sense of thermal &nb=
sp;registering which is felt through the nostrils of his somewhat draconic =
facial features.  It was how a snake would detect it's prey and the sa=
me held true for other reptiles.  He narrows an optic and speaks with =
a whisper.</div><div><br></div><div>" Night Viper, wait.  Something do=
esn't feel right.  I'm picking up vibrations through the wall and my t=
hermal imaging system is detecting an unknown entity.  You're reptilia=
n derived as well, see if you can detect the same as I ."</div><div><br></d=
iv><div>Tucson moves in closer to protect the smaller Maximals from harm.</=
div><div><br></div><div>" If someone is following us we must move cautiousl=
y."<br><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. </div><div><br=
>On Oct 20, 2011, at 12:31 PM, Super Cyclonus <<a href=3D"mailto:supercy=
clonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrote:<br><br></div><div>=
</div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>




<span style=3D"display:none">&nbs=
p;</span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
      
      <p>> <OLD=
><br>
><br>
> Tucson quietly maneuvers himself down the tunnel wit=
h surprising agility,<br>
> perhaps not as quickly as Night Viper but ye=
t somewhat nimble himself.  His<br>
> clawed like hands and foot talons =
curl around the ladder giving him<br>
> exceptional agility. His wings t=
hough were an issue, but he keeps them tight<br>
> against his back.  Wh=
at he did not have use of was his serpent like tail,<br>
> which had qui=
te a formidable grip as he discovered upon squeezing the piece<br>
> of =
scrap metal.<br>
><br>
> Because of his somewhat serpent like form, h=
e found that perhaps his beast<br>
> mode would suit him better in the t=
unnel, because all he would have to do is<br>
> slither while using his =
limbs to slide him along.  But that would cause<br>
> noise and vibratio=
n.   He carries on in robot mode, staying behind to back<br>
> up the sm=
aller Maximals.<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
The tunnel itself was a tight=
 fit. Although TUSCOn and BIG CONVOY were<br>
able to fit down it, with the=
ir bulk it was only just barely. There<br>
was not even enough room for eit=
her of them to transform if they<br>
needed to. Although TUSCON would fit i=
n the tunnel in robot or beast<br>
mode, the act of transforming required a=
 little more room then the<br>
tunnel would allow for. And BIG CONVOY's bea=
st mode, that of a woolly<br>
mammoth would definitely not work going down =
the tunnels.<br>
<br>
The trip was long and aurduous, even for this MAXIMAL=
S. Crawling<br>
through level upon level of tunnel, they passed by other pr=
ison cells,<br>
some empty, others seeming to have occupants, that judging =
by the odd<br>
smells, had a more biological rather than technological orig=
in.<br>
<br>
"We're almost there." NIGHT VIPER whispered from below. "Every=
thing<br>
should be ready."<br>
<br>
BIG CONVOY nodded from above, "It bett=
er be, I'm ready to get out of<br>
this place." His voice was low but there=
 was a steel to it as well.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
Preston<br>
